intro: Dichrocephala capensis, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-to-orange daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions and has a sprawling, bushy habit. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, while its stems are often woody at the base. Dichrocephala capensis is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
